quest.name: The Prodigal Daughter
journal: Meffrid would like to introduce you to the village elder.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I couldn't have been older than five when we left this place. My memories are...hazy at best.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: Raganfrid, the village elder, is over by the shore. No time like the present─let's have a word.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: ...Don't know you, traveler. You a merchant? You'll not find much custom here.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: Greetings and well met, elder, and sincerest apologies that I did not send word ahead of our arrival. Too long have I been away from Ala Gannha, and I would know of your recent troubles.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Ah, you are comrades of Meffrid. I see, I see...

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Speak on, though I suspect I know your purpose.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: The Griffin came with many men, and left with many more. Such is the rumor. Is it true?

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: He lit a fire in their hearts and then dangled a dream before their tired eyes. And now you come to steal away what few remain.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: The Griffin was a traitor and a madman, and we had no part in his schemes. We have made an agreement with the Alliance─this time it will be different!

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: This time? This time!? Cold comfort to the dead and the ones they left behind! How much more must we give before you've had your fill?

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: But...but surely you hate the Empire as much as we do!?

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: They took our lands, our traditions, even our god. And they demand a fifth of what little we've got left. Aye, I hate the bastards. With every fiber of my being.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: But hate's not enough, Meffrid. I can't...we can't keep doing this. I'll not tell anyone you came, but you need to go. Now. Leave us be, and never return.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You've got no right to speak to us like that─

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: I've got a quarry that was producing barely enough to keep us fed, and that was before half our young men and women went off to die for your bloody cause!

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: So yes, I've got every right to tell you to leave my village!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...No. You don't. Because it's my village too. My home!

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: What in the hells are you on about─

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Wait... I know those eyes. You're one of Curtis's girls!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Lyse. Lyse Hext. And I'm here...I'm here to take back my homeland.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: By Rhalgr, the last time I saw you, you were... I didn't even know if you were still alive... And I never thought you would come─

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I almost didn't. And my sister never will. Lots of others won't either...and that's why we've got to carry on the fight.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: You even sound like him... <sigh> As you say, I've got no right to tell you to leave. Ala Gannha is as much your home as it is mine.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: But I say to you again: we can give no more.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Yes, I heard you the first time.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Let's go.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <sigh> We didn't come here to fight. I hope I haven't made a mess of things.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: That could've been handled better, but what's done is done. At least we've been granted permission to stay.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Do what you will and say what you like─you'll find no recruits here.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: I was hoping Raganfrid might help us to recruit some of his people, but that clearly isn't going to happen. If we're to convince any of them to join, we'll first need to regain their trust.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: It's risky, and it's hardly subtle, but I say we approach the villagers directly─see what problems they've got, and if we can do anything to help.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Makes sense to me. Let's split up and ask around.
